column4: Everything was of top standard, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation the decoration was lovely, clean and well maintained, Nadir made our dinner most memorable he was really helpful and has left the best impressions, I had a lovely meal with my husband, thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è

The view was outstanding, the food was great and the service is super professional, Nadir was so friendly and very helpful, i would like to thank him for his kindness and for his professional behaviour. I really recommand this place, it was an unforgettable experiance.

Old need some serious renovation , it's in the middle of it all , right in downtown , staff are friendly although it takes a lot of time to check out due to lack of staff , the roof top bar is nice and the food menu is not bad as well , breakfast variety is kind of poor , and if u arrive late to breakfast u shall notice that most of the items are done , their elevators system is so slow , and it seems they re always under maintenance, spa is great , all in all my stay could have better

Disappointing. The hotel feels a little tired. I was amazed to see smokers in the lobby bar - allowing the smoke to drift into the reception area. Really - in 2022?! The lifts are possibly the worst I've ever experienced. Even the porters/conciergere acknowledged how slow they were. Another guest I'd met said he's spent 12 mins waiting for a lift and then stopping at several floors before he got to his floor. I'd also flag that although the hotel's location is good you can still hear all the beeping from the traffic below so It's not a quiet location. The room I was given on 18th floor was very spacious with a great view (fi you like heights) but the bathroom felt old and the shower holder didn't work - I had to just hold it. The hot water tap for the bath wouldn't turn on so‚Ä¶

This was a much needed restful, quiet and rejuvenating. The food was exceptional but hey its Morocco. The views were remarkable i loved being on the floors way above the street. The toiletries were brilliant quality lotion, soap and shampoo. This I highly recommend.

Kenzi tower is a modern, well situated hotel in Casablanca. However, the service is lacking. Despite multiple requests we never received an extra pillow. The bar manager is rude and unprofessional. We ordered two drinks and after 20 minutes with no drink appearing or any evidence it was being assembled, we canceled our order to attend a scheduled dinner. Forty five minutes later the manager attempted to deliver the now unwanted cocktails. He accused us of lying that we canceled our order despite several others affirming our cancellation. This is horrible behavior by someone in a service industry.

Good views and comfortable bed, but the bathroom was dangerously slippery on the floor. There was no milk or tea/coffee making facility in the bedroom and the hotel food was just OK. The main gripe was that there was no hot water for the shower and bathroom in the evening....just after we had arrived from the airport

Part of our Gate 1 travel tour, we stayed there for our last night. This hotel has 28 floors, the views outside our room was impressive. The hotel is modern with big bedroom , fancy bathroom however the flooring in the big shower is quite slippery, one has to be very careful. The restaurant is on floor 27 , it has such magnificent views and the food was delicious, especially the salmon.

I can‚Äôt believe that it‚Äôs 5 star hotel, very bad service and management, we booked two rooms and the second room was only given after 2:00 am with so many difficulties, we delivered our own luggage and push the trolley. The keys doesn‚Äôt work, the rooms has no amenities and the bathrooms are stuck the water doesn‚Äôt go. The night manager Ibrahim was very rude and didn‚Äôt want to assist us he throws the phone on us, when we complained we were not taking seriously and they just let us leave, we forgot our very expensive luggage and they didn‚Äôt call us to let us know. We had to call and we were informed that the room wasn‚Äôt under our name. Briefly the whole system needs to be fixed ASAP

column3: Unfortunately very disappointing, on the whole nice hotel!
column4: My husband and I booked the 7 day tour from Casablanca. After our tour we wanted to relax and unwind a bit for 2 nights. We booked the hotel, because there was still a room with a view of the sea free, was really the reason why we chose the hotel. That was probably a handle in the loo, hardly arrived there were already problems, because a credit card was required (2000 Dirham as security if anything should be) where we knew nothing about it, so we also had no credit card with us, with another card it then worked through debit, but otherwise we would probably have had to withdraw the money with expensive fees. Then we were offered a tea, where we then waited in the lounge about 45 minutes! for our room, (we arrived in the evening) to then receive the message that our room with a‚Ä¶

I only had the pleasure of staying there one night but I found the hotel to be well appointed, with a very helpful staff, I had a very early morning flight and they brought me a breakfast tray that was fantastic. My wake up call was an actual person knocking on my door!

Noisy hotel as it has always been , front desk staff not cooperative..room 1407 facing the street and low floor.. No water in room , no fruit basket . ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è .. Stayed 3 nights on a recent business trip. Nice hotel, great room. The staff were all very good, very polite and very professional. Used the pool a few times and it was good. The bar on the 28th floor has some great views especially at sunset. Really nice breakfast.

I had a wonderful time in Kenzi Tower for a business trip. Staff were accommodating especially Chaima the one ushering our event and Nabil (security staff) who were helpful and kind. We had a successful business trip because of their assistance.

The staff are very accommodating and welcoming. I love how they attend the guests. Specially FATIMA SAHRA i love how she serves our food. Shes very nice and friendly to all the guests. Very professional indeed.God bless her

I love how the staff accommodate our needs, especially the breakfast I will they have much more selection in buffet but over all it was so nice, Fatima Zahra and samahan in buffet area help us with our needs they gave us excellent service. GodBless

column3: Hospitality and warm service from hotel breakfast
column4: The staff was helpful and friendly. They can communicate in a few languages. The food is nice and they serve Moroccan and international breakfast. Especially for sweet lady miss Fatimah Zahra and smahan. Recommended to back to this hotel.. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

column3: Disappointed at staff at Top28 bar.
column4: Here solo with a tour and we all went up to Top28 bar to see the night view on our last night in Morocco ( Saturday night) and even though there were seats available we were told "no, we're full" by the female host who wasn't nice about it at all and she was letting in people behind us. So was it we weren't dressed appropriately or young enough or maybe it was our nationality?? Was very disappointed. Not friendly at all and wouldn't come back just for that reason. The room was nice.

This is my first time in Casablanca. All the staff are very helpful and friendly. Amazing breakfast with delicious choices. Special thanks to Said Makboul. He is really nice, professional and serve me and my colleagues from the heart. We‚Äôd love to have another stay again here. Thank you.

Nice room. Very large room with a comfortable bed. Large bathroom with large tub and shower. The restaurant for dinner was quite impressive with beautifully presented and delicious food. The service was outstanding. The restaurant for breakfast was disappointing. Worth a stay if the location fits your needs.

Dear Ms. Katia Bitton, I had to research on who the GM is so I can address you properly. This is my first time in Casablanca and in your hotel. I was pretty excited cause the concierge and bell, and the guy who greeted us and served us our welcome teas were very warm and friendly. However things went downhill quickly that night. Right after I had my dinner out and got back to the hotel, I wanted to relax and de-stress cause I had quite a long day. First I requested for slippers and extra towels cause I knew instantly that the gap between the shower glass door and the step would cause the water to flood the rest of the bathroom which i totally understand so I thought the quick fix would be to place a bathmat beneath. ( I did ask for towels because I only had one towel and one‚Ä¶

I spent one week in Jen I tower hotel, good location, in the center of Casablanca city, a good service, staff helpful, , I liked the new restaurant in the 2 end floor, a good buffet of the breakfast, and the best view of the sky 28 in the 28 floor. I recommend this hotel

I am staying for 2 days met my friend in Casa, room not clean properly, bad found some hair, house keeping girl just open my door while I sleept even I hanged DND at my door and nothing to say and left, call the Reception to change the towel because yellowish color the till 3 times then 1 hour latwr coming. Overall not satisfied.

column3: My heart touched by their hospitality
column4: Big thanks and big love for all staffs, your smile, your sincerity, your professionalism, your hospitality, your generousity, (especially everyone who worked on 31st May and 1st of June, any of you, front desk, housekeeping, everyone who worked in breakfast time, concierge, and any of you which I can‚Äôt mention it one by one), i felt you all did everything with your heart. I'm falling in love with Morocco because of you guys, Keep it the good things!! And hope to feel your hospitality again, soon üòòüòò

Tea master Said Makboul of Kenzi Tower Hotel was a delight! He described the featured tea so well: its origins and characteristics, as well as its rich history and culture. In addition, he demonstrated and involved us in the Moroccan tea ceremony, making our tea experience memorable. Great job, Said!

column3: a large room with vews for miles
column4: We had a room on the 7th Fl, what a view of the city for miles ! Room was very spacious with a bit of sitting area. Wash area had seperate toilet, shower/Bath, double wash basins. Came with electric kettle and tea/coffee - unfortunately one has to pay for tea or coffee. We had problems with safe and kettle initially, but it was dealt with quickly and efficiently by the same staff.

This was a towering hotel in Casablanca. The rooms were very spacious. I got an entire suite with a large bed and an entire leather sofa set. Bathroom was modern and there was a separate toilet closet in keeping with other hotels through Morocco. The carpet needed cleaning. Next morning I woke up with sinus issues. The view was great from this hotel. We had our farewell dinner on the 27th floor and got 270 degree views of Casablanca including the Hassan the second mosque.

column3: Worst hotel we stayed at in Morocco
column4: Thank goodness our stay here was only one night. Firstly, this is the highest building in Casablanca, maybe even all of Morocco. So, be prepared for long elevator waits. As well as having to breath in a sickly floral scent in every hallway while you wait!The top two floors are for a bar and dining and yes, you do get spectacular views if you can see through the filthy windows. The white wine at the bar tastes like turpentine and while they advertise a wide assortment of beers, they only had two when we were there. Our room was nice and large but felt like a sauna when we entered. After an hour of fiddling with the air conditioning, my husband went to the front desk to inquire if there was something he was doing wrong. The response: yes, they knew the rooms on that side of the‚Ä¶

Not as luxurious a main floor layout as some but given the location understandable. Staff were pleasant. The breakfast was what you would expect from a Moroccan hotel. What is wonderful and unique is the top floor bar. The view of the city is wonderful. Drinks are decently priced. Good selection for a downtown hotel.

We stayed at the Kenzi on March 6, a warm 75 degree day in Casablanca, but much much warmer in our 9th floor room. Sweltering. No A/C. Apparently the lower floor rooms are cooler. You can't open the windows. By midnight, the room was moderately cool enough to sleep in. Overlooking this, the hotel was well situated near shops and a 25 minute walk to the old Medina (well worth it). The views from the top are spectacular.

The hotel is almost good, with very helpful staff. The breakfast is various, the fitness room need to be more large, the swimming pool is very nice including jacuzzi. The hotel need to be modernized and style to be changed, we can easily smell the carpet when entering room. The hotel is good and I recommend it mainly for business purposes since it has a good business area (meeting rooms)

Check-in : We asked to have a seat in the lounge while waiting for check in. It took awhile to get checked in (at least 30 minutes) but considering that we arrived around 11 and check in is not until 2, not too bad. Room: Room was comfortable. Restaurant: We had dinner and breakfast included in the rate. Both were fine. Not memorable. Did not use the pool

So my girl and I spent one night here for our anniversary. We wanted to treat ourselves a bit. That night was very much a let down. So I left a very very negative review on TripAdvisor titled "An Overpriced Letdown." Surprisingly, I received a message from a staff member named Katia apologizing, saying they would address the issues and that we were invited back for an all expenses paid stay. I felt froggy, so I took them up on the option for our last night in Casablanca. I gotta, say, not only were we met by Katia in the lobby and greeted kindly and professionally, but they did not even take my credit card on file. We were escorted not to the same room as before, but we got an amazing upgrade, to a corner suite that had a bottle of wine and snacks waiting for us. They scheduled‚Ä¶

It was a wonderful stay at kenzi tower Good location and Very good staff handling sooo nice and helpful especially mrs Meriem and Mrs Afaf and hamza reception team I wish you good continuation !! I looooove kenzi

Located within walking distance of a synagogue. Nice room. Good buffet breakfast and buffet dinner with many selections. Drinks are extra at dinner or were for our group. Goof WIFI too. The only negative was the slow checkin in for our group

column3: Excellent hotel with great views and staff
column4: We stayed here on two different nights on either end of our 9-day visit to Morocco. Wonderful view of the mosque and the ocean. Staff was excellent. Fitness facilities were good. Bar and restaurant were good.

column3: View of the mosque and the sea
column4: Our tour group stayed here on our last night in Morocco, and it really felt like any American or European capital stay due to the modern nature of the hotel, but for a last night that was fine. The room was very spacious with a great view. The rain shower and all of the other parts of the whole shower ant tub enclosure could be quite treacherous if one fell- it made us nervous, although it was lovely to look at. The bar and restaurant at the top were festive for our farewell dinner. There is a mall nearby, but not much else. Staff was not particularly helpful when there was a key problem.

column3: Simply the best hotel in CASABLANCA
column4: Incredible stay ...service is impeccable and attention to details is superb. The most attentive staff and the best concierge I've encountered! Would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat! Simply the best hotel in CASABLANCA

column3: Loved our time at the hotel
column4: My husband and I had a wonderful time at the hotel Kenzi tower. The service we received was amazing and the staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. We loved everything. There are so many nice touches in the room (thank you meriem !! ) .. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Casablanca .

I really enjoyed staying here. The place was clean and the staff was wonderful. They worked hard to make us feel we are the most important guests they had. Thank you for everything, we will come back for sure .

I‚Äôm a regular guest at the Kenzi, max 2 nights as for business. The service at the breakfast is excellent. Especially Amin and Mouchsin...also the frontdesk members...always great and friendly and if possible they upgrade me. Nice warm pool that you can enjoy after a busy day.

This my first time I had overnight in this hotel. The hospitality and service overall were very good. I really appreciated they are very nice. Especially I met one of guy he is staff on the restaurant during breakfast he know that I was confuse because I looking for maroccoan tea but I couldn‚Äôt find on the buffet then he tried to help me. He was very nice and keep asking what I need else. I still remember his name is Mouhcine. Thank you very much for your kindness

We stayed here our last night in Morocco with our tour group. It is located in a busy area of the city. A quick walk around the area didn't yield any convenience or wine shops. Anyway, we were lucky enough to be assigned a room on a high floor and the view was spectacular. It looked out to the sea and the beautiful mosque. However, we couldn't take pictures because the window was full of dots which obscured our view from close to the window. The room itself was very nice, spacious and clean. The beds were huge and very comfortable. The bathroom is big and the shampoo and other toiletries are nice. The only drawback is that it's difficult to figure out the rain shower and the other shower in the tub is hand held. The tub itself is a deathtrap-it's so slanted that you‚Ä¶

Stayed here recently and after a bit of research I decided to book, the breakfast while it had many choices wasn‚Äôt great, the rooms were large and so too was the bathroom, but the shower layout was confusing and stunk and the carpet in the rooms need to be changed!! Three things going for the hotel (1) the staff are friendly (2) Sky 28 bar (although all you can smell is cigarette smoke ü§¢ (3) location close to supermarket and shops. Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again, sorry.

The room was spacious with an amazing bed very comfortable! The bathroom was also huge and very clean. The only disadvantage what was that it was close to the road and it had a little noise from the traffic below. the food was also good

A very nice business style hotel it could be anywhere in the world. The rooms were very nice with good amenities, however, whoever designed the bath/shower combination should be forced to use it. It was very attractive but not the least bit practical. Breakfast was very nice with a good selection.

Good Hotel with a fantastic sky view! The rooms are large and polite, the breakfast and the dinner were good but not excellent. It could be better pay the beverage at the end of the stay, so the staff would be more relaxed and smiling!

Kenzi Tower Hotel is a modern hotel in Casablanca with stunning views of the city especially if you visit the 28th floor. Our room was clean and modern but could have used a bit of updating (bleach stains on the carpet). The room was very large. There was a strange smell in the hall during our entire stay. We were on the third floor so it could have been from the restaurant on the floor below.

The bathroom was among the most beautiful I have ever seen! The room very spacious and clean with a nice view and the food was good but not excellent. The staff is very polite and the location of the hotel is near shops and a super market.

This is not a 5 star hotel. The guys at check in were the least friendly ever- room satisfactory, but not real clean, hot water doesn‚Äôt work well, toilet doesn‚Äôt flush well, not enough toilet paper, breakfast is dirty and picked over. Staff is talking in a corner and unhelpful. All in all stay elsewhere. Not a great place to stay . I met the GM who is lovely and clearly tries to do his best in spite of a staff who needs training in every aspect of running a good hotel. One highlight great concierge.

It was a nice hotel. We went up to 28th floor and it was a bar but you could see the whole city. The room was so nice. I only spent one night at the hotel but I wish I could stay longer. Breakfast was fine.

We checked out and were told that the cash will be returned to the account to hold on and give it a few days. Never happened It‚Äôs been over 2 years. I followed up so many times with these rogues. Beware!

This was the last hotel of our 13 day trip. It is in the middle of the city, as far as I could see. My room was wonderful with a view on the city. It was large, king sized bed and wonderful bathroom. We only spent a few hours before we went to our farewell dinner, but many of us met at the roof top bar to say good bye to each other. No complaints, just hoping some of us will meet again on another trip!!!!

column3: More luxury than you would even find in the US
column4: Beautiful modern hotel with all imaginable amenities, Beautiful views from floor to ceiling room windows of the ocean, the Hassan II Mosque and downtown Casablanca. Very good restaurants in the hotel. Interesting electronic elevator control I had never seen before, initially you may end up on the wrong floor, but easy to figure out. very high end

This hotel is very clean and comfortable but just like most big modern hotels (a bit sterile). Bathroom was really good and aircon worked so well I got cold. View from top floor bar is extensive. Dinner on 27th floor was pretty ordinary, but buffet breakfast much better. Location of hotel is right in city but wasn‚Äôt a particularly nice area to stroll around. For the money I‚Äôd recommend staying somewhere else, like a smaller hotel with a bit of local personality and charm. I also stayed 2 nights at Melliber (next to The Mosque) and found that a better location and value with very friendly staff.

After going to our room I looked out and we were on the front of the building with all the traffic noise. I went down and they immediately switched to the back of the building. The bed is very comfortable but the pillows awful.The appearance of the bathroom is fabulous, appriciate all the bath amenities but the designer should be fired! Getting in the bath tub I almost broke an arm, it is shaped like a deep wine glass with the plug in the middle. So you will slide down all sides and your bottom compresses the plug to drain the tub. Getting out? hope you are not alone or you will be trapped. Since the bathroom is all glass walls if one person gets up early and turns on bath lights it lights up the whole room. *Yes it has coffee and tea pot but they were not plugged up and the‚Ä¶

column3: Not a bad choice for our short stay
column4: Only spent one night there, but it was a pretty decent business hotel with almost a luxurious yet modern feel. Nothing ‚ÄúMoroccan‚Äù about it other than the lovely views of the city from some rooms on the higher floors - but I don‚Äôt mean anything bad with that. Rooms were clean and tasteful with brand new fancy bathrooms and all necessary amenities. Food was sort of OK but most indifferent. Its Sky 28 bar provided easily accessible good fun with amazing views. Its other bar located on the ground floor was cuter and more elegant with its live soft jazz piano playing - but no views there! Overall it wasn‚Äôt a bad hotel choice for our brief stopover in Casablanca.

this hotel was our last stop of the trip, sadly only very short one night. The location was central, with magnificent views of the city. The hotel is very modern, clean and we had a very nice dinner as a group of 23, everything was very tasty and pleasant to look at.

We arrived for a one night stay for a special occasion to what seemed like a really nice place. It was a bit pricey but the reviews made it seem worth it. Coordinating the reservation the night before and day of was a bit confusing with bad communication from the staff. Once we got to the room - which was smaller than expected (Deluxe Sky Room) the bathroom and bed looked great - and were. The bulk of our issues were poor staff. First issue was the chairs in the room were covered in food pieces and crumbs. The carpet seemed a bit dirty too. But the view was good - despite these painted white dots that mess up any decent photo of the view, so give up that idea immediately. There was a minibar for drinks but no food snacks. There was one towel and one bathrobe. Seriously? We‚Ä¶

Good clean hotel with all the usual amenities including a safe in the room. Fantastic views of Casablanca from the high bar lounge area. Staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English.

I really love the hotel.. The service is always perfect, the crew staff is friendly and so kind. It is the higher place in Casablanca where you can see all the city clearly. Every night the liveband and the DJ play good music in the sky 28 Bar to make us enjoy the Afterwork, its a place where we can also watch football matches when its the season. Thank you to lamia anwar karim and hamada for everything I will always advice everybody to visit this freat place.

I stayed their during my business trip to marrakesh reception staff during check in were very nice they gave me a really good room with fantastic view , didn't like concierge were not helpful left me while giving me directions without to finish or apologize to do something else came up .. breakfast was just ok but not super was disappointed 9f very little choices they had.. staff first day were not smiling or helpful second day totally opposite.. very strange no consistancy .. thanks to amazing chef kamal who tried his best to make us able to have breakfast , check out was not smooth or fast kept us waiting long to solve an issue w our agent .. that's why not signature except only room I got and kamal

We have travelled back to what we consider the Best Hotel in Casablanca. We are greeted as family by Khalil one of the Duty Managers, his care and attention, his friendly and considered approach make him such a valuable asset to the Kenzi. He, along with Afaf and Meryam from Guest Relations are three of the main reasons we come back almost on a monthly basis. Nothing is ever too much trouble for either Khalil or Afaf, they make us feel like part of the Kenzi Family and every stay is special. Every trip starts with smiles and a genuinely warm welcome from Bushra, Younes or Sana on reception with a smooth and painless check-in. In our room we have a personal greeting from Patrick (the Hotel GM) & it's always a pleasure to catch up with him during our stay. Its safe to say‚Ä¶

The reception and concierge service was excellent. The 28th floor restaurant had great food and service. The location was good for shopping and the locals were very friendly. I got disoriented while shopping and a local woman stopped and gave me directions in perfect English. The only issue I had was the road noise in the room. The hotel windows were not good against the outside noise.

I found blood stains in my bed and had to call housekeeping twice to get their attention. It was really disgusting experience. I was not able to sleep all night. I would not recommend this hotel. The location is good and front lobby is nice.

We were on a tour of Morocco and this was the first hotel we stayed in. Staff were friendly and efficient, booking in was a pleasure. Room was large and airy with a great views over the city. Its well worth going to the top floor bar after dark to see the view, very impressive. Food was excellent, loads of choice. Breakfast also good, staff a little slow at relaying tables but nothing to worry about. The only niggle is that the tea and coffee supplied in room only provided one of each, which is ok when theres only you but with two of us only one can have a cup of coffee. Highly recommended

I came here with a Gate 1 tour and received a fantastic 12th floor corner suite with amazing views of the city. The room was clean, modern and had a comfy bed and seating area. Dinner on the 27th floor was great and servers were excellent. The lounge on the 28th floor is a great spot to grab drinks with live entertainment and great night views. Lots of shopping nearby and a Starbucks a few blocks away. I really enjoyed my stay!

The hotel is very good. However, they use too much air freshener that makes me sick. Also I booked the room through Cancelon for $150.00 US dollar/night. The invoice does not say I will need to tax. By the day I check out, I was charged 99.00 MDH/room for city tax and promotion tax.

Fairly new skyscraper 15 minutes taxi from main train station. Rooms were spotless and spacious with great views over Casablanca at sunset. Excellent fast wifi. Breakfast was a highlight with so much choice. Lovely staff. Recommended.

Loved the elevators..punch floor number and you are directed to specific elevator and never have to enter floor again. Genius! Bed was comfortable and guest powder room was a welcome luxury. Housekeepers were especially attentive.
